dialogues.text: Two inmate orderlies are hefting sacked cadavers from a c into an incinerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June 9th: Of the original four dozen, over 75% are now deceased.  Strangely, no clear patterns have emerged as of yet. Another body thuds onto the pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batch 5 seems to have no common discernible effect on any specific group though the men seem slightly more resilient than the women. When it is full, they move to the next door until the car empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hoping the survivors will provide more answers or my time here will have gone to waste. Red heat suddenly glows from the oven vents as the orderl throws a series of switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Surridge moves down the drab aseptic hallway accompan by an armed guard.  Roman numerals on the doors to each c ascend to five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June 18: And only five left now.  Two men and three women.  Which tends to contradict my entry on the 9th. She pauses at room five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in room five is a fascinating case. She looks through the small chicken wire glass window in door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Physically, there doesn't seem to be anything wrong with him.  No cellular anomalies, nothing. In the back, just on the edge of the room's shadow, sits man in room five, silently staring back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batch five, however, seems to have brought on some kind of psychotic breakdown.  He's quite insane. Dr. Surridge can't seem to break her stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has this way of looking through you.  Reverend Lilliman won't go near him.  He claims that it is the devil in room five.  I see him cross himself whenever he passes his door.  Still, there's something about him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Surridge slowly moves through the Larkhill garden, an incredible abundance of fruits, vegetables and violet car roses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad Prothero let room five have a go at the gardening project.  He is quite proficient.  Prothero was reluctant to allow an inmate access to the tool and chemical supply at first but now the fat toad is delighted.  The crop has almost doubled. She traces the petals of a rose with her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also grows roses.  Beautiful roses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Surridge and several other Larkhill appointees relax after dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: December 24th: I was in the mess.  It was about half past ten when we heard the first explosion. A massive explosion shakes the building to its very core, windows shattering and hooded pendulum lights swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men and women clutch at their throats as they tumble out the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ones at the front ran straight into the gas.  It was horrible. They drop to the ground, gasping and vomiting. The back door is kicked open, Dr. Surridge following two guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of us made it out through the rear door.  You could hear men screaming everywhere.  I hate the sound of men screaming. She looks out, men running, collapsing, dying in a yellow green haze that seems everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the camp, everything was on fire.  Everyone running in all directions.  We had hardly enough time to get our bearings when the ovens exploded. Another explosion wracks the compound.  The pillar of fla rises into the black sky, dwarfing the men in the camp. Dr. Surridge sees a gaping hole in the medical block, its insides turned out like an unholy birth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the man in room rive.  I couldn't have known.  The chemical supplies, grease solvents, ammonia, fertilizer.  He'd been making things with them. Close on a soldier, doubled over, hacking up bile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mustard gas... A sticky blue fire licks up from a blackened body like a flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And napalm. Dr. Surridge turns as a silhouette crosses the yard, back by a curtain of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the yard, I saw him.  He had the flames behind him.  He was naked. The man stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looked at me... Dr. Surridge seems to wilt under his stare but cannot loo away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if I were an insect.  Oh god.  As if I were something mounted on a slide. The flames convulse hypnotically behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looked at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch snaps Dr. Surridge's journal shut. He sits in front of the Leader's desk puffing on his pipe while Susan stares coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last entry until six months later when Dr. Surridge is back in London.  There is no mention of the man in room five again.  End of story. He tosses the journal on Susan's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except that it wasn't the end of the story. Finch rises, crossing to the wastebasket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between 2009 and 2012, over forty men and women who were previously stationed at Larkhill met with what were believed to be accidental deaths.  Eventually, only three remained. He taps his pipe into his hand, pouring the contents into wastebasket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three he'd been saving until last. Finch brushes the ashes from his hands and begins repacki his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone who worked at Larkhill.  Everyone who could have identified him.  You see there are two possible motives here.  Not one. Susan raises his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first is revenge.  He escapes from Larkhill and vows to get even with his tormentors.  The whole exercise an elaborate, chilling vendetta. When he finishes repacking the pipe, he replaces it in hi mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the explanation that I find most reassuring, funnily enough.  Because that means he's finished.  It's over now. Finch begins relighting his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second motive is more sinister.  Like I said, everyone who could have identified him is dead. A flame leaps into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he's just been clearing the ground? Another burst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he's planning something else? The lighter slips back into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, the diary we found was in full view.  We didn't have to search for it.  He left it there.  He wanted us to find it.  He wanted us to know the story.  Or... Finch returns to his chair, letting out a huge cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all we know, the diary could be a complete and utter fake.  Codename V could have written it himself. Finch leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's playing games with us.  He might never have been at Larkhill at all.  Do you see?  It could all be another smoke screen, a false trail, another cover story --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! Susan punches the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Finch, would you please explain to me the nature of this meeting?!  Because I was under the impression that you had some information about the terrorist, codename V! And punches it again until his fist hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more questions, understand!  I want answers!  I am not interested in where he grew up, what kind of flowers he likes or his favorite color! Susan's collar chokes his face to an unnatural crimson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I make myself clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Leader. After a moment, Finch stands, Susan hanging on his last w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dismissed.  England prevails, Mr. Finch. Finch turns, Susan calling after him as he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Finch, the girl.  Do you have anything on the girl? Finch pauses at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Leader.  Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey stirs as voices drift in from the hall outside her d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, cow. Three guards are silhouetted in the doorway of a cramped cell.  Still sluggish from the chloroform, Evey looks dow the coarse slipover she's now wearing. One of the men, Rossiter, crosses toward Evey, swinging a pair of shackles.  He grabs Evey, slamming her face down the hard cot, driving a knee between her shoulder blades. Evey screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsk.  This pathetic whore is the famous Miss Hammond? The shackles bite down on her wrists as they laugh in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made a mistake. Rossiter stands her up, shoving her into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  I haven't done anything -- He slides a thick hood over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said shut your hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hood is lifted from her head.  Evey squints hard, awa in a blinding, burning light. A man sits, unmoving, at a desk across from her, a guard his side, both backlit by a harsh white kliegs. Evey's eyes start to water as she blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why you're here.  Evey Hammond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please, I didn't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me to be more precise.  Did you participate in the murder of Dr. Delia Surridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you participate in the murder of Derek Almond, director of the Finger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you participate in the murder of Bishop Anthony Lilliman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, I don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever participated in a terrorist act against your country?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the identity of codename V?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a lying cunt. A monitor next to the desk lights up.  From the snowy sta an image begins to form. A girl is talking to a man.  She is shoving her hips at h propositioning him.  When more men appear from the alley, Evey realizes she is watching herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were going to rape me, kill me -- Rossiter grabs a handful of her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. She swallows hard when she sees V emerge on the screen. image freezes on his smiling face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This board will not tolerate any more of your lies, Miss Hammond.  We have over 120 minutes of audio and videotape and 75 pages of testimonials from eye witness that identify you as an accomplice to the terrorist, codename V. The monitor blinks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to know why you're here?  You are formally being brought up on charges of murder on fourteen counts and sedition against your Leader and country which brings an automatic sentence of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  I didn't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Process the prisoner and return her to her cell until she is more cooperative. Rossiter slips the hood back over Evey's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey cries as a rough hand runs a pair of electric clippe over her head.  Huge sheaves of her hair fall to the grou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey lies crumpled on the hard floor, unmoving, as a tray food is slid through a slot at the bottom of the door. She watches as a rat crosses from a hole in the wall, sniffing the murky rendered gelatin in the wooden bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey hangs limply from a set of manacles as she is washed deloused by heavy hands. She coughs in the yellow bug powder cloud as it burns her eyes and the red welts on her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey is curled up on the cot like a dry fetus, now gaunt wrapped around her legs.  She blinks when she hears somet moving in the rat hole. Evey raises her head as something is pushed through the crevice. Tentative fingers search the hole, pulling out a length o toilet paper.  Over every inch of it is a delicately scra message. We move into the rathole, its edges slowly filling the fr until black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back from a shadow, the outline of the interrogator' silhouette against sharp light coming into frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read her letter.  Hid it.  Slept.  Woke.  They questioned me.  And I read her letter again. Rossiter is buckling Evey's thin arms and legs into a cha Her now frail frame can barely hold up the frayed brown slipover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over and over... On the table in front of her, there is a large wash basin water.  Rossiter dunks her head into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name was Valerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teacher reads from her lesson plan in front of rows and rows of uniformed pubescences in this all girl private school.  Her voice drones on and on like Muzak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was born in a rainy burg in Nottingham in 1975.  I passed my eleven plus and went to girl's grammar. A blonde tomboy sneaks a smile to her curly haired friend next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met my first girlfriend at school.  Her name was Sara.  Her wrists.  Her wrists were beautiful. Her hand slides across the desk, fingers tickling the you flesh of Sara's wrist. The teacher's voice slows, dropping octaves, becoming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sat in biology class staring at the pickled rabbit fetus while Mr. Herd said it was an adolescent phase that people outgrew. Valerie looks at Sara across the room, her head down in shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara did.  I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two teenage girls stand in front of a middle aged couple. They are holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1994, I stopped pretending and took a girl called Christine home to meet my parents. The greying woman repeats the sign of the cross over and over, sobbing into a handkerchief.  Her husband's face is contorted in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week later I moved to London to go to college and study drama.  My mother said I broke her heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two young women cuddle on a park bench under a London sum sky, feeding the pigeons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it was my integrity that was important.  Is that so selfish?  It sells for so little but it's all we have left in this place... The black haired girl nibbles on the blonde's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the very last inch of us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey struggles against Rossiter's weight who keeps her he submerged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But within that inch we are free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. Rossiter wrenches back and Evey sucks hard for air, cough out water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Miss Hammond, let us review the facts. Evey stares at him, eyes red, heart pounding in her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work for codename V.  Codename V killed Delia Surridge and then Derek Almond with your help and that is why you were found outside her home. Evey begins to shake her head, water sluicing off her thi face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what happened, Miss Hammond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, that isn't true --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear, Rossiter? Rossiter grabs Evey's neck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait! Plunging her head into the bowl.  Water fills Evey's nose ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: London.  I was happy in London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The packed house watches as a Prince kneels before a woma bare foot with a slipper of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I played Dandini in Cinderella. The woman glances into the dark sea of faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world was strange and rustling with invisible crowds behind the hot lights and all that breathless glamour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two women weep in each other's arms, embracing in a perfe knee high meadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work improved.  I got small film roles, then bigger ones. The blonde woman brushes away a tear from the other's che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 2006, I starred in "The Salt Flats."  That's where I met Ruth.  We fell in love. We pull back and see we are on location for a movie and t two women are being filmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth and Valerie sit on the couch watching television.  O the table behind them is a bouquet of violet carson roses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every Valentine's Day she sent me roses and, oh god, we had so much.  Those were the best three years of my life. The two women stare at the newscast in tears, the sound o marching coming from the set's speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 2010, they came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of marching explodes as columns of men in brown uniforms and jack boots fill the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after that there were no more roses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rossiter presses his elbow onto Evey's neck, holding her submerged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for anybody. Rossiter lets Evey up.  Her red burnt lungs gulp at the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the takeover, they started rounding up the gays.  They took Ruth while she was out looking for food. Evey blinks hard, black fireworks exploding in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are they so frightened of us? She wheezes, on the edge of unconsciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burned her face with cigarettes and made her give them my name.  She signed a statement saying I'd seduced her. The interrogator's voice melts into a slag heap of sound the hot, rhythmic pounding in her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't blame her.  God, I loved her but I didn't blame her. Rossiter uncuffs Evey, slipping the black bag over her he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she did. Evey's knees buckle as he forces her to stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She killed herself in her cell.  She couldn't live with betraying me, with giving up that last inch.  Oh, Ruth. Evey weaves down the hall.  Rossiter shoving her from beh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came for me.  They shaved off my hair.  They held my head down a toilet and told lesbian jokes.  They brought me here and pumped me full of chemicals. The cell door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't feel my tongue.  I can't speak. Rossiter yanks the hood from her head and pushes her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is strange that my life should end in such a terrible place but for three years I had roses and apologized to nobody. The iron door slams shut, lock ringing in the stale air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall die here.  Every inch of me shall perish... Evey rolls to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except one. She crawls for the rat hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An inch.  It is small and fragile and it's the only thing in the world that's worth having. Her shaking hand pulls the letter from the stone crevice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must never lose it or sell it or give it away.  We must never let them take it from us. Evey clutches it like a rosary as she begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are but I hope you escape this place.  I hope that the world turns and things get better and that one day people have roses again. She holds the note to her face, her tears soaking into th fragile paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are but I love you.  I love you.  Valerie. Slowly, Evey slips away, succumbing to blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had come to know every inch of those four walls in that dark hell and they knew every inch of me.  Every inch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud lights blare against Evey's solemn face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except one. A typed document sits on a small tray table in front of h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My name is Evey Hammond.  On the 5th of November 2019, I was abducted by the terrorist known as codename V and then taken against my will to an unknown location." Rossiter hovers just behind her as the Interrogator reads confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Once there, I was systematically brainwashed by means physical and psychological.  I was frequently subjected to sexual abuse during this period." Evey's expression is unchanging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Eventually I was terrorized into helping him commit the murders of Derek Almond, Dr. Delia Surridge, and Anthony Lilliman, Bishop of Westminster." Rossiter drops a pen on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I, the undersigned, swear that the above statement is genuine and that it was not signed by means of intimidation." The pen slowly rocks to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like you to sign that for us, Miss Hammond.  Where we've put the little cross. She blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish. Rossiter begins unbuckling Evey's restraints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escort Miss Hammond back to her cell, Rossiter, where she will wait while you arrange a wet detail of six men. He forces Evey to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then take her out behind the chemical sheds and shoot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens behind Evey as she rereads Valerie's lette for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time, unless you want to change your mind. She holds the tattered piece of toilet paper to her chest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign that statement.  You could be out inside three years.  Perhaps they'd find you a job with the Finger. Evey closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you but I'd rather die behind the chemical sheds. Her last words hang in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there's nothing left to threaten you with, is there?  You are free. He turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She listens as his footsteps fade down the hall, the door hanging weirdly open. Evey takes a few tentative steps toward the door and stic her head out into the empty hall, peering down both ways. Slowly, she emerges from her cell, retracing her path dow the hall that her blindfold never allowed her to see. Quietly inching along the wall, Evey peeks around a corne gasping at the rigid guard standing off to the side.  The is something about the man's frozen stare that keeps her running. Evey straightens and crosses to the guard. It is a mannequin. She touches him, the wheeled platform he is mounted on rolling back against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door creaks open as Evey enters the room where for so long she was questioned and tortured. She crosses to the frozen Interrogator sitting at his des Her finger brushes lightly against the plastic hand, then Evey raps a knuckle on his hollow wooden head.  Around hi neck a small speaker hangs from a cord. Evey drifts uneasily into a back room where a discarded prison guard's uniform hangs on a rack.  On a table next wig and pair of gloves, the rat looks up at her through t bars of its tiny cage. She moves through another door, the wind suddenly knocked from her chest as she finally sees where her prison was built --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V steps from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, Evey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... Her mouth hangs open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this... to me. Evey's rail thin figure begins to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this to me! She stumbles against the wall, unable to support herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You -- You hit me and -- and cut my hair.  It was you.  It was just you all this time. She doubles over, covering her face as she bursts into te

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tortured me.  You tortured me -- Evey looks up at him, body shivering as he quietly glides toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I love you, Evey.  Because I wanted to set you free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love? A look of horror twists her starved face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set me free?  Don't you realize? Slender fingers ball into fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you realize what you did to me?  You nearly drove me mad! Disgust and anger light up her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you. Her little, wiry body coils tight as she circles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you!  Set me free?  You put me in a prison to set me free?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were already in a prison.  You've been in a prison all your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  I don't want to hear it.  I wasn't in a prison.  I was happy!  I was happy here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happiness is the most insidious prison of all, Evey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's warped!  That's evil and it's wrong!  What gives you the right to judge?  Who are you to say what's not good enough?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were born in a prison, Evey.  I didn't put you there.  I just showed you the bars.  You've been in a prison so long, you no longer believe there's an outside world. She wheels away from him, covering her ears, trying to ge away from his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  You're mad!  I don't want to hear it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because you're afraid, Evey.  You're afraid because you can feel freedom closing in on you.  You're afraid because freedom is terrifying. Evey falls, stumbling through the labyrinth of the Shadow Gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't feel anything!  There's nothing left to feel!  Don't you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't back away from it, Evey.  Part of you understands the truth even as part pretends not to. She collapses, head pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman, this is the most important moment in your life.  Don't run from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what -- Oh god -- I can't breathe -- V couches next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  You're almost there.  Go closer.  Feel the shape of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing to me?  I can't breathe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in a cell.  They offered you a choice between the death of your principles and the death of your body. He cradles her as she hyperventilates, tears streaming do her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel -- I feel like I'm going to burst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you'd rather die.  You faced the fear of your own death and you were calm.  Try to feel now what you felt then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god -- I felt -- The mask hovers over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like an angel -- He squeezes her shuddering body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, V, I'm so scared.  What's happening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the cage is open, Evey.  All that you feel is the wind from outside.  Don't be afraid. Gently, he lifts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to walk.  The lift will take us to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof?  Outside? He helps her to an open elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I don't want to be blindfolded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Evey.  No more blindfolds. The cage in the elevator rattles shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two figures stand in the door of the roof access, a raging tempest oozing from a split sky. Something draws Evey out into the storm. Slowly, she walks beneath it, the wind and rain pounding against her thin frame.  Evey lets the coarse slipover fa to the ground and stares straight up into the storm, nake the elements soaking into her very being. V moves up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's so -- different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  Five years ago, I too stared beneath a night like this.  Naked under a roaring sky. A low rumble of thunder washes over London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night is yours, Evey.  Seize it.  Encircle it within your arms. His words buffet against her with the sheets of rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bury it in your heart up to the hilt. She raises her arms to embrace the raging torrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Become transfixed and transfigured --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jagged bolt of lightning shatters the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch gets out of a police car and looks up the black fac the modern building.  He sighs and taps his pipe against heel of his shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch! Finch turns to find Dascombe hurrying towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what this is all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I can guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Remember, remember, the fifth of November."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on.  He's long gone.  He has to be.  He did what he came to do and it's over. Finch chews on his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for us. He turns and heads into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark November sky hangs like a shroud over the building

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heads of each department are gathered around a table black granite. Peter Creedy, sitting back out of the lights, is the new of the Finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have given you almost a year and you have given me nothing.  Nothing! He glares at Finch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Adam, there is no one better than Finch and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Dascombe, I do know it.  It is that very fact that keeps me awake at night, wondering if perhaps there is a reason that Mr. Finch has failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying that perhaps I don't know you as well as I thought I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking for my resignation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I am asking for some goddamn results!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Finch's fault, Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've all been looking.  The man simply disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone, Adam.  It's over. The Leader trembles like a volcano set to blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, is it?  He's gone.  Vanished, you say? The Leader grabs a large box from the floor and hurls rea of computer printout across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transcripts recorded over the last thirty days in which the terrorist was talked about or mentioned in a positive context.  This is only thirty days! He punches a "play" button and a wall of monitors blink o It is a recording of a television variety show. A character that is made to look like Adam Susan is givin speech.  A woman is dressed like V except that the only t she is wearing under her cloak is a garter belt, stocking and high heels. V sneaks up behind Susan and yanks his pants down.  Susan outraged but when he gives chase he trips over his pants. The audience hoots and howls. The Leader kills the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what you consider, "disappeared?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For god's sake, Adam, it's a stupid variety show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Creedy, I want the producers, writers, and actors of that "stupid variety show" arrested and charged with sedition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be serious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push me, Roger, push me and you'll find out how serious I am. He stares each of them to silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, this V is still out there.  I can feel him like a sickness worming its way into the hearts and minds of the public.  Something must be done, and done quickly, to exorcise this demon for the very soul of this country is at stake. He pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is why I am compelled to give each and every one of you notice that if by the fifth of November you are still giving me nothing more than excuses, I will have to revoke your party status and terminate your positions. Everyone is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Creedy, I will speak with you in private.  The rest of you are dismissed.  England prevails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader stands at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Creedy, as the new head of the Finger, you are the most important member of my cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, appreciate your faith in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your predecessor, Mr. Almond, was a good man, a man who understood what strength in unity meant, a man who, above all, loved his country.  I need to know if you are such a man. His eyes bore into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love your country, Mr. Creedy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police car is parked in a dark alley.  It is raining an the windows of the car are completely steamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, yes! He is sweating, his knuckles white as he squeezes the steering wheel, panting. We hear a noise like a very wet kiss and then a woman's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The most important member of my cabinet."  Yes it is, isn't it, dear? Helen lifts her head out of his lap.  Her lipstick is sme about her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stop when you stop.  What did he say next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't -- She whispers in his ear while playing with his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Peter, what are you afraid of?  Almond used to tell me everything and you're twice the man he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me... if I loved my country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I can tell you do love your country, almost as much as you love this... She lowers her head into this lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he asked me to do something... oh, oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, I can't.  I can't tell you. Helen lifts her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told you to frame someone as the terrorist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god?!  How did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Adam Susan.  Now who was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  I can't tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can, honey.  You can and you will.  You have to trust me, love.  We're going to help each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that face.  You see?  You're just bursting to tell me. Her head drops back down.  Creedy moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now who was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was... Fi... Fi... FINCH! The name seems to orgasm from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch sits alone in his modest apartment, reading a book. The book is Koesterler's, "The Roots of Coincidence." An old CD player is playing music, a Bach piano concerto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V is playing the exact same concerto on his piano, his gl fingers gracefully flitting across the keys. Evey enters the gallery.  Her hair has grown out but is s short.  She projects a kind of strength that comes from a deep inner peace. V coaxes the final delicate notes and lets them softly fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was beautiful. She walks up to him and takes the smiling face in her han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've wanted to do this for a long time. She bends and gently kisses the frozen lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, V.  Thank you for everything you've done for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it all yourself, Evey.  I just provided the backdrop but the drama was all your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a good backdrop.  I believed it.  I really did.  It's still a bit hard for me to accept that it wasn't real.  That it was just you.  Especially the letter. She takes the letter from her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a beautiful letter, V.  Every time I read it I could feel Valerie, almost like she was holding me.  I believed in her most of all.  I believed that she loved me and I loved her back. She looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel a bit foolish telling you this.  I know that you must have written it and thought you should have it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't write that letter, Evey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a shrine.  The walls are covered with movie posters reviews and pictures of an actresses named Valerie Page. recognize her as the woman chosen for the medical block j before V. Everywhere there are flower boxes filled with blooming ro violet carsons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Valerie Page.  She was the woman in room four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wrote the letter just before she died.  I delivered it to you as it was delivered to me.  The words you wept over were the same words that transformed me. Evey smiles and bends to smell the roses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roses.  You grew them for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey, do you know what day it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days before the first day we met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remembered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're planning something, aren't you, V?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me too well now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to fulfill an old promise. Evey cocks an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a lantern, V leads Evey down a dark stone stairc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been here before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  It is the deepest part of my home.  Once you know it, I should think you'll know everything. He pushes a button and a secret passage opens in a heavy stone wall. There is a small narrow series of passageways that he gui her through, leading to another door.  Evey steps out int underground subway station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked beside the concrete platform is a beautiful antiqu train car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, V, it's lovely.  Where on earth did you find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way, I suppose it really found me. Evey steps into the train car and finds it filled with li packages wrapped in wax paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in these packages?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gelignite. She screams and almost drops one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with all of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.  I'm going to finish what was started four hundred years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does this train go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the old Victoria line but it is blocked, blocked somewhere between Whitehall and St. James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitehall... V, that's the New Government Building. V nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the underground has been shut down for years.  How are you going to make it run without any power?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought I might ask them to turn it on for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader sits bathed in the flickering images of the Fa computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Creedy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's set, sir.  No worries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight. On one of the screens, a television program has just begu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight on Tales from the Bible, a story of treachery and betrayal from the Book of Daniel. We cut from that screen to another screen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television studio where Roger Dascombe surveys a larg bank of monitors filled with the images of typically vapi television entertainment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of London's waiting.  Ready, two.  And here we go -- A player locks on as a recorded program begins.  We move as the logo slashes across the screen: Storm Saxon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, England's greatest hero repels the forces of darkness in a brand new episode. We pull back from the show's opening teaser and find ourselves looking at a small television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the delivery bay at the back of Jordan tower, five security guards are riveted to the heroic actions of Stor Saxon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Storm.  Save me!  Save me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mongrel trash, if you harm her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out, de white debil has a laser lugar! Behind them, a shadowy figure in a cloak and tall hat ent the loading bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what the -- ? They all turn and find a smiling V. They go for their weapons.  V goes for them.  It is bruta and quick, knives slicing in bloody arcs, bodies kicked a thrown with superhuman power. The TV crashes to the ground and we move in at it as Stor Saxon stands triumphant beside his buxom lass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Storm, hold me.  Hold me tight. We pull back on another television screen inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic is chewing on a hamburger, engrossed in Storm Sax Across the room, Finch is reading the "Roots of Coinciden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you stand that tripe. Dominic answers with a mouthful of cheeseburger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Es gooh. Finch shakes his head, reaching for his pipe.  He realize is out of tobacco.  He slides open the bottom desk drawer his eyes almost pop out of his head. He stares into the drawer like someone staring at his own tombstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch?  Finch, what's wrong? Slowly, he lifts something from the drawer.  On his desk, lays out several knives, a cloak, a hat, and a smiling ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Finch lifts the mask and almost has to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see, Dominic? He puts the mask to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V emerges from an elevator and immediately attacks severa more guards.  A surveillance camera watches as V steps ov their slumped, broken bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard sees V on the monitor coming directly the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody hell! He grabs the machine gun, aiming it just as V kicks open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze! V stops.  At least five guards have trained their weapons him.  He is surrounded. Slowly, he lifts his arms as though surrendering.  His cl opens, revealing enough TNT to level the entire building. his hand is the plunger detonator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck all. V nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open as Creedy and a group of heavily arm Fingermen muscle in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creedy?  What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to arrest Mr. Finch for acts of treason and terrorism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were you, boy, I'd shut my hole unless you want to start explaining why you didn't say nothing about Mr. Finch's secret identity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V follows Roger Dascombe into the main control booth.  Th door shuts behind them and they are alone. All around them are the laugh tracks and gunshots of the evening's entertainment. V puts his hand into his cloak and pulls out a videotape. hands it to Dascombe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch glares at Creedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just shoot me, Creedy?  Wouldn't that make everything a lot simpler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I suppose it would. Creedy smiles, his finger tightening on the trigger when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Christ!  Creedy, you stupid ape!  If Finch is V then tell me who is that? He points at the television where V sits calmly at a desk front of the "VTV" logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody fuckin' hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was time we had a little talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to be at Jordan tower.  Come on! Finch and Dominic rush out of the room.  Creedy looks at confused men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't just stand there!  Follow them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V smiles at the horrified Adam Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sitting comfortably?  Good.  Then I'll begin. The Leader screams, pounding on Fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you!  Damn you! He hits the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, ready my transport.  I want every armed man within a hundred miles at Jordan tower.  Now! We move in at VTV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, I imagine there are hundreds of soldiers rushing here to kill me because someone does not want us to talk. We pull back in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family watching television.  In the background, two children are squabbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush.  Turn it up. The husband does.  V's voice gets louder as we move towar him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are afraid that I am going to say the things that are not supposed to be said.  They are afraid that I am going to say the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man sits on his couch, mesmerized by V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is that there is something terribly wrong with this country, isn't there?  If you look about, you witness cruelty, injustice and despotism.  But what do you do about it?  What can you do? He pops his beer tab and the beer foams over the couch bu doesn't seem to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car races wildly towards Jordan tower as Finch and Dominic listen to the broadcast on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are but a single individual.  How can you possible make any difference?  Individuals have no power in this modern world.  That is what you've been taught because that is what they need you to believe.  But it is not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader seethes, staring at three television monitors his limo which are all filled with V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why they are afraid and the reason that I am here; to remind you that it is individuals who always hold the power.  The real power.  Individuals like me.  And individuals like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar is almost completely soundless except for the voi of V.  People stare at the television as if the moment we somehow suspended in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have come to offer you a deal.  If you accept, I will give you a different world.  A world without curfews, without soldiers and surveillance systems.  A world that is not run by other men but that is run by you.  I am offering you a second chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The military forces have begun to swarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred years ago, a great citizen made a most significant contribution to our common culture.  It was a contribution forged in secrecy and stealth although it is best remembered in noise and bright light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd has gathered, watching through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To commemorate that glorious night at precisely the stroke of midnight, the edifice of their world will erupt with enough sound and fury to shake the earth.  All I ask is that you join me at the gates to watch as the past is erased, the pathway cleared so that together we can start toward a new day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader climbs out of his limo and is met by one of hi captains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this man dead!  I want him shot on sight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch can see the forces gathering outside Jordan tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you ask, who am I to make such promises?  A fair question but hardly necessary as you know me already.  To know me any more you need only look to a mirror. Finch catches a glimpse of himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VTV fills every screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth be told, this wasn't even my idea, was it?  If you think back, you'll remember that night, whispering in your lover's arms.  I became a part of your plan just as you have now become part of mine.  Give me the line of the queen and I'll give you your secret dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy battering ram is rushed down the hall, carried by four soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the twelfth stroke of the fifth day of the eleventh month, I hope we shall all meet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is much larger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until then, I bid you goodnight. Every screen suddenly goes black.  The crowd turns to eac other, unsure of what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door explodes open.  V is standing alone, almost as i waiting for them. Before he can even move, they shoot.  Machine gun fire li up the room.  V's body dances and jerks backward, smashin through an observation window -- Falling to the television stage below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A path is cleared for the Leader.  As he heads into the television studio, an armed soldier is heading in the opposite direction. It is impossible to tell because of the dark face plate b it looks like the soldier is smiling. The Leader shoves his way onto the main stage.  A group o soldiers is gathered around the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was it?  Who was he? The mask is pried off, revealing the lifeless face of Rog Dascombe.  To the Leader, it is an obvious revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger Dascombe!  Of course.  Of course!  It makes such perfect sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I think there has been a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  There is no mistake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir, there are people that say they saw both the terrorist and Dascombe together --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  Who are these people?  They must be detained immediately.  Whatever they saw or whatever they think they saw is subordinate to the truth and that truth is that Roger Dascombe is the terrorist and the terrorist is dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought I was the terrorist. Finch's voice stops the Leader cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I'm not in jail and since you have another, even more convenient suspect.  I'm guessing the charges have been dropped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, Finch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am careful, sir.  Always.  That is why I suggest that a search of this building begin immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrorist is dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, I disagree and I believe that he is presently trying to get out of this building disguised as one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you challenging my authority?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir, I'm trying to run an investigation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am trying to run a country!  When I tell you, Mr. Finch, the terrorist is dead, then the terrorist is dead!  If you continue to suggest otherwise then you will leave me no choice but to have you arrested on charges of sedition.  Do I make myself clear? He eyes the room.  Everyone is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, it is imperative for the people of London to know that they are safe, that the terrorist is dead and everything is under control. The Leader storms past Finch who looks at Dascombe and bi down on his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Ear's black vans has been modified with large speakers wired to the roof.  As the van rolls down the street, the speakers drone with a looped message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrorist is dead.  No further threat exists.  Everything is under control. Out of the back, soldiers hurl leaflets that swirl and flutter in the van's wake. The little girl on the bicycle that we saw earlier stops picks up one of the leaflets. It has a picture with the body of Roger Dascombe beneath headline, "The terrorist is dead!  London is safe once again!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bollocks. She crumbles the leaflet and throws it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bollocks! She gets off her bike and takes something out of the backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not dead!  It's all bollocks! Turning to a nearby wall, she spray paints a large circle around a "V".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A recording of VTV plays on the small television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... if you give me the line of the queen, I'll give you your secret dream. Dominic freezes the image; V stares at them, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Finch.  We've seen it fifty times.  I mean, after what they done to you, I don't know why we're even trying to stop him. Finch stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  For twenty seven years, I've been at this job.  Twenty seven years, I've done what I've been told to do.  Maybe that's all there is to it.  I'm just a dumb old dog.  A dumb old dog that only knows one trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't it, Finch.  It's more than that.  I know you.  It's something personal with this one. Finch smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  And maybe I'm not ready for a revolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we got less than thirty hours to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the tape.  I know it.  I can feel it.  He did this for a reason.  He needs something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line of the Queen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's a line from Shakespeare.  Or a book.  I don't know. He rewinds and starts the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... This wasn't even my idea, was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But right here.  He's talking to someone.  Someone specific.  Someone who knows what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think back, you'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V continues on a different television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that night, whispering in your lover's arms. Helen Heyer is lying on her bed, eating chocolates, watch V through calculating eyes. At her feet, we hear a suckling noise that suddenly stops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen?  Helen, why did you want that tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Conrad.  I'm thinking. She shoves her foot back into his mouth and he continues suck on it and each of her toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... now you've become a part of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?  How did you know that? Conrad moves up her ankle, licking and kissing his way to knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what, my love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the line of the Queen and I'll give you your secret dream. She freezes the tape.  Her eyes light up and she smiles b at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  You have a deal. Conrad licks along the inside of her thigh until she slap him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!  Not you.  Conrad.  Not yet.  Here you can have a chocolate.  Open up.  Open! She shoves the candy in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy.  As for the rest of the box, perhaps when you're Leader. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now I need something else Conrad.  I need you to use that pretty little brain for me.  You know all about the old underground, don't you? He nods still gagged with the candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know everything, understand?  Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are cameras set in front of the large black leather chair so that the flashing images and data of the Fate computer system can be seen behind the Leader. A makeup artist mattes down the Leader's lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready in five, Leader. The makeup artist adjusts one last hair and scurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In four, three... He points and the camera's red light goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same family, the same squabbling children watching as "Special Bulletin" interrupts a laugh track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening London.  As Leader of this great country, I felt it imperative to speak with you and to assure you once and for all that the shadow that recently fell across our land has indeed passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for fuck's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we have endured this long year was no accident, no mere coincidence.  This was not a simple act of terror conducted by a singular madman.  No, this was a test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drunk struggles up onto his bar stool blocking the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not me, nor the Party, nor the government that was threatened this year.  It was our beliefs.  Our faith.  I believe that God himself bore witness to our struggle and like Job I believe that we have been vindicated. The drunk raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember fifth of November! The bar cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader reaches for his Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know this?  Let me read to you where I found the answer, where I so often find the answer.  In the Scripture.  Revelations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The megaphones blast the Leader's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "If any man have an ear, let him hear."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are stacks of printout everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He that leadeth into captivity shall go into captivity; he that killeth with the sword shall be killed with the sword.  Here is the patience and faith of the Saints." Finch stops reading, listening to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And I beheld another beast coming out of the Earth; and he had two horns like a lamb and he spake as a dragon."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another radio crackles with the Leader's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And he doeth great wonders, so that he maketh fire come down from Heaven on the Earth in the sight of men." V nods, almost laughing as Evey enters the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And he deceiveth them that dwell on the Earth by the means of those miracles which he had the power to do --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, V, turn it off, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, my dear. He reaches over and changes the frequency.  We hear voice hushed and secret but we recognize them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how does he know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  All I know is he does... And I know what he wants. The voices are labored, punctuated by gasps and moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that, V?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, Evey, is what I have been waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what I want?  I want you just like this... Bent over that black leather chair... We are pulled by the radio into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we see a tiny microphone hidden in the ceiling ligh above the bed. Helen moans as we drift down, glimpsing Helen, her arms reaching for the edges of the bed, her back arching up towards Creedy, behind her, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Conrad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'll handle Conrad and V will take care of Susan.  The mob will take care of the guard and then... You can use the Finger to take over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use the Finger?  You mean like this? He inserts a finger into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... oh... that is vulgar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, oh yes, oh you're a pig, Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I am, misses.  But I'm the pig that's gonna be running this country. That sends a shiver through Helen's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes and I'm... I'm going to be Eva... Oh Eva... Her eyes close and her fists knot the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Don't cry for me Argen... oh Argen... Argen... tina! The word is almost lost in her orgasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over London.  It is the morning of the four

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch looks through the blinds at the morning sun.  He ha been up all night.  He checks his watch: 6:00am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen hours. Rubbing the knot in his neck, he turns back to his office which is now buried beneath mounds of paper. Dominic is passed out, sprawled on the couch, and clutchi printout from Spencer's "Fairy Queen."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic! Dominic jumps, immediately searching the printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic, go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've still got over three hundred lines from The Fairy Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  There's no more time.  You go home and get some rest.  You're going to need it tonight. Dominic lets the papers fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got us, doesn't he, Finch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad pulls his car into his reserved space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen holds Conrad's chin the way a mother holds a child she is telling them something important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen to me, Conrad.  This is the most important moment of our lives.  Everything I've worked and hoped for comes to this.  Susan is a very dangerous man, especially now, that's why I need you, Conrad.  I need you to be stronger than him.  I need you to be the better man.  Understand? Conrad nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do this Conrad, and you do it right, I'm going to turn you from the little man I married into the man of my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Helen. He embraces her to kiss but she turns her perfectly paint lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on the lips. Ardently, he kisses her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch sits alone, palms pressed to his bleary eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up, old man.  You're not even sure you want to stop him. With a red pen, he begins absently drawing red circles ar any V he sees on any piece of paper. Victims.  Vectors.  Values.  Victory.  Words from quotes lists. Suddenly, he stops.  Carefully, as if reaching to touch a butterfly, he slips a single sheet out from the sheaves covering his desk. The paper has a long list: the names of all the Queens of England.  He has circled in red the V in Victoria. When it hits him, it hits him like a falling safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ!  That's it!  It's got to be it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intercom clicks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, Mr. Heyer is here to see you.  Says it's urgent.  And he's here with his wife, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir -- Wait, you can't go -- The door slaps open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leader, I'm terribly sorry but I absolutely must speak with you. The Leader waves the Lieutenant off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something to tell you, something important but -- She glances at Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you and only you.  In private. The Leader studies her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a matter of national security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his car, Finch races to a corner and slams on the brak He gets out, staring at a shadow on the ground: a "V" in circle. The shadow is cast by a sign for Victoria Station, part o the abandoned subway. The gates are chained shut.  He fires his pistol into the lock, kicks open the rusting gates, and descends into the underground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader closes the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what's this all about, Mrs. Heyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, forgive me.  I've been so afraid, afraid to come here to talk to you.  I thought he must know.  I was terrified he knew but I had to come because I knew you were the only one that can protect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protect you from what? She is unable to go on, seemingly about to burst into tea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now, Mrs. Heyer. He touches her and it is all she needs.  She buries her f into his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't let him hurt me, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let who hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrorist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrorist is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, how I wanted to believe it, Leader, but I know it's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know who the terrorist is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is alone with Fate.  He glances about nervously, moving closer and closer.  His fingers reach out and graz the main keyboard.  Taking a deep breath, he turns and be to type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader takes hold of Helen by her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  Who is it, woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Conrad, Leader.  Conrad.  My husband is the terrorist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad accesses the department of water and power.  He fi the correct file and begins rerouting power to a once dea system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hanging light suddenly sizzles to life.  V looks up, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader stares hard at Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him, Leader.  In the middle of the night.  I heard something.  I went to the landing and that's when I saw it. She clutches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That mask.  That hideous smiling mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how did you know it was Heyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Leader.  I know the way a woman knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have no proof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, proof?  This is an extremely delicate situation, Mrs. Heyer.  It has been reported that the terrorist is dead.  It would be a catastrophe to arrest a man now without concrete, conclusive proof.  Do you have any evidence at all? Tears well up in Helen's eyes as she shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you're right, if Heyer is indeed the terrorist... His eyes fly wide and he spins away from her, throwing op the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leader!  Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad sits calmly across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything all right?  Helen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Heyer, your wife has done her duty to her country. He turns to Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Mrs. Heyer.  You will be taken care of.  I will launch an immediate investigation and I promise, you will be the first to know when an arrest will be made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Investigation of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subversion, Mr. Heyer.  Your wife was privy to the dialogue of subversives.  That's all you need to know at this time.  Lieutenant! The Lieutenant appears almost instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Heyers are leaving.  I need to see Mr. Creedy at once. Helen looks up at the Leader, a smile hidden near the cor of her perfect red lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. The Leader nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen and Conrad get out of the elevator, standing beneat the rows of new party flags that line the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to go straight to your office and wait for me to call.  When I do, I want you to come immediately home.  Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Helen. She embraces him, pressing her body against his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Conrad, I'm so proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it, Helen.  I did it, didn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you will never forget tonight. She almost kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Conrad. Smiling, she pivots on her heel and heads for the door. reaches for her when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Heyer!  Mr. Heyer! The front desk guard rushes towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, this package arrived for you, sir. He hands him a small, brown wrapped box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He looks back for Helen but she is already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single flashlight beam creeps toward us as Finch search the detritus of the dead train line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting at a stoplight, Conrad decides to open the packag Inside is a cassette tape.  The light changes and a car behind him honks.  He starts forward and inserts the tape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch crawls up onto the platform of V's hidden station, staring at the beautiful old train car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strangling the steering wheel, Conrad listens to the tape The speedometer climbs as everything seems to accelerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what I want?  I want you just like this... bent over that black leather chair. Helen moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch steps inside the car, his flashlight sweeping over stacks of gelignite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scream builds in Conrad.  With tears in his eyes, he st out the windshield but sees only the images created by th tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use the Finger?... You mean like this?... Oh... That's vulgar... But you like it?... Yes... oh yes. Conrad loses control and the car careens up onto the side and smashes into a brick wall. Lifting his bloodied forehead, Conrad looks out and sees ubiquitous poster partially destroyed by the crash: "Stre through purity, purity through faith."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch hears something and jerks back, almost falling out the car.  Aiming his gun, he finds no one.  He turns and bolts. As the sound of his footsteps fade, V steps out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader's Lieutenant looks up from his desk and sees F rushing towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the Leader in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but he's meeting with the Captain of the Guard.
