dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Finch, you can't go in -- Finch charges through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader and his Captain turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Finch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leader, I need as many men the Captain can spare and I need them right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To capture codename V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creedy opens the trunk of his car.  In the phosphorescent glow of the streetlight, the set of knives gleam.  He bun the costume that he tried to planet on Finch into his arm then slams the trunk. Above, a window blind that was cracked open snaps shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader moves towards Finch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's underground.  The old subway.  I know exactly what he's going to do.  If we move quickly, we can be there, waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad waits, hidden inside a bedroom closet.  He hears t front door close and his grip tightens around the handle long, steel-necked hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader is steadily convincing himself of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leader, every second we delay... The Leader lifts his hand, silencing Finch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be no discussion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if Mr. Finch is right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sick to death of this terrorist being everywhere and nowhere!  I will judge whether Mr. Finch is right and I will judge it with my own eyes!  Do I make myself clear, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir! Finch is suddenly overwhelmed by a feeling that is common chess players.  It is the disturbing sense that you have done exactly what your opponent wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem, Mr. Finch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Captain, mobilize your men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find this bloody bastard and we will finish him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey sits in the gallery, reading Pynchon's "V" just as V done.  She suddenly feels V watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Evey smiles as V steps out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V, what's going to happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change, Evey.  That's all.  Just change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it going to be violent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I suppose it will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creedy empties a bottom drawer, making room to hide the costume.  As he does, the closet door behind him slowly creeps open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V stands at the jukebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?  Why must is be violent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, Evey, that is the nature of change.  She is a temperamental creature that appears in earnest rarely but, when she does, she will wear one of two faces.  The first face is the destroyer.  It is lamentable but all true change begins with death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark figure stands over Creedy.  The hammer raises, a s of silver against the velvety darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V punches a button on the jukebox just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hammer falls with a sickening soft crunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song begins to play; a melancholy song that says good to love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood pours down Creedy's snarling face, he snatches one V's knives as another hammer blow cracks through his coll bone. He screams, lunging at Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V listens to the song, the smiling eyes somehow knowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hammer falls again and again until the metal head is slick with blood and meat. Conrad stumbles back, dropping the hammer.  He looks down the hilt of the knife protruding from his stomach.  He ya it out and holds V's knife which is bright red with his o blood. He collapses to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the other face, V?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other face?  She is the true face of change.  The face of the creator.  She is the one that remakes the world.  Evey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, V?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask you for a favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a small thing but it would mean a great deal to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never danced before.  I've thought about it many times, here in this room, listening to the music.  But I've always been alone. Evey smiles and crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be my pleasure. He opens his arms and she steps into them.  They dance, standing very close, his gloved hand holding tightly to h her smile against his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of military vehicles swarm around the entrance to Victoria Station while heavily armed men pour through the gates of the underground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Evey.  You are an excellent dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All it takes is a little practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alas, I have run out of time. He bows, pressing his frozen lips to her hand.  Evey is suddenly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V?  What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you remember?  I have a date tonight, Evey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming back though, aren't you? She seizes hold of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V, I won't let you leave unless you promise me that you will come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I'll be back.  You don't think you can be rid of me now, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. She lets him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers swarm through the station.  Susan stares in shoc outraged by the mere presence of the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark my words, Mr. Finch, this man is going to become an example so that every man, woman, and child in this country will remember what happens to those who would ever think to stand against the state. He turns to the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I need a gas unit down here with enough nerve gas to fill every rat-hole in these tunnels. Suddenly the lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that will be necessary. The Leader smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are over one hundred of the best trained soldiers in this country down here.  Let him come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five soldiers creep forward in a tight formation, their flashlights probing every nook and cranny. Behind them, a secret passage opens and V steps out. He is among them with frightful speed, a grinning dervish with blades like metal fangs ripping and rending flesh, slashing bright in the flashlight. Other soldiers rush towards the screams and gunfire but t find only five bodies and warm blood running down the wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, what's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign sir.  Repeat, no sign of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lost him. From the opposite end, there is another series of screams machine gun fire that lights up the dark tunnel for a mom Then, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This... this is a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you're a coward, Mr. Finch. Back in the tunnels, V drops from above, his cloak a swir cloud of squid ink that hides him in the darkness. Again, quicksilver knives lash out, drawing fonts of bloo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch can feel the panic that is spreading through the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leader, we have to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was your idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a mistake.  This is what he wants.  He knows us, Leader.  He knows us too well.  We have to get out of here before it's too late -- A voice rings out from hidden speakers, echoing through t tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening citizens of London.  This is the voice of Fate.  Your fate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What trick is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, the face of London is going to change and I am going to offer you the chance to change with her.  Your Leader is finished.  He will not leave these tunnels alive. The Leader screams to be heard over the resonant voice of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an outrage!  I order you not to listen to this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At midnight tonight, the Head will be destroyed and a new era will begin.  You must now decide if you are going to be a part of that era. Everywhere, terrified soldiers listen to the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can choose to stay here and die with your Leader or you can choose to be free.  The decision is yours and yours alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, order all your men to fall back and secure this position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of you have wives.  Some of you have families.  All of you have lives.  Consider each of them as you ask yourself, are they a part of the past, or are they a part of the future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall back.  Fall back and secure the central platform. Deep in the tunnel, two soldiers look at each other.  Simultaneously, they drop their guns and run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any man that disobeys this order will be court marshaled! Groups of solders drop their weapons and disappear into t shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain!  Captain, where are your men? The station fills with the sound of boots running wildly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, I will not tolerate this insubordination!  I want those deserters shot, Captain. Finch slowly draws back away from the Leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot on sight! The few men on the platform are soon the only men left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!  You!  Point position.  We're getting out of here!  Now! A knife sings through the air and buries itself in the Captain's chest.  With a tiny rasp, he falls to the groun The remaining men bolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traitors!  You cowards! He grabs for the Captain's machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are!  I'll see you hang!  Every last one of you! "You" echoes down the dark empty throat of the tunnel. The Leader looks around, his flashlight sweeping in big a as he realizes that he is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch?  Finch!  Finch, goddammit, you can't leave me!  Don't leave me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are going to die as you ruled -- The Leader screams, whipping around towards the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone. The smile is as cold and as sharp as the knife that flick from his hand. The Leader raises his gun just when the knife sinks into shoulder. Howling in pain, he drops the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you!  Damn you! V smiles into the spot of his flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad?  Is that you?  You're working with Finch, aren't you?  And Creedy!  You're all in this together! V closes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, most of all, should know, Leader.  You created me.  Without you, I would never be.  More than life, Leader, you gave me purpose. V draws his final blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He that killeth with the sword, shall be killed with the sword." V raises the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! V and the Leader turn to find Finch aiming a machine gun V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Finch!  Oh god, Mr. Finch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the knife. V does and Susan begins an almost hysterical laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I knew it, Mr. Finch.  I knew you wouldn't desert me.  You're a good man, Finch.  A damn good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mr. Susan.  No, I'm not.  I'm a man who does his job and does what he's told.  For twenty seven years, that's all I've been. He steps toward V, staring into his smiling black eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, Mr. Finch.  He's quick as the devil. Finch ignores the Leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read Delia's diary over and over all year.  It sickens me but I am unable to judge her.  I am as guilty as she.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Finch, what are you doing?  Shoot him.  Kill the bastard, Finch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no excuse.  I did what I was told to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch, I order you to shoot him!  Finch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job was to find you and catch you.  I've done my job.  I've done it for the last time.  I'm tired of it.  I'm tired of it all. He tosses the gun to the Leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him yourself if you can. The Leader seethes, his eyes boring into Finch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, V.  And goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mr. Finch. The machine gun burst shatters the quiet concrete silence Finch falls dead at V's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you, Finch, the penalty for treason is death. He aims the gun at V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real question is, are you? The Leader laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really believe you can pick up that knife before I pull this trigger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But I don't have to. Almost casually, V bends down to pick up the knife -- The Leader screams and fires. Bullets knock V back a bit but he continues, grabbing the knife and standing. Eyes widening with disbelief, the Leader fires another bl as V begins walking towards him. The machine gun roars, bullets shredding out through the of V's cloak as he continues with short deliberate steps until -- The hammer clicks against the pin.  The gun is empty. V stands before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see?  You cannot kill me.  There is no flesh and blood within this cloak to kill.  There is only an idea. V smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ideas are bulletproof. The Leader screams. V drives the knife into his heart, killing him instantly. V stands alone amidst the carnage and seeping pools of re His body wavers.  He takes his hands out from beneath his cloak and reveals his gloves, wet with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens and Helen enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creedy?  Creedy, you dumb bastard, you left your car parked in front. She walks up the stairs to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you?  Creedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into the room, her sole and heel sinking into t plush carpet soaked with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. When she sees Creedy's head mashed open, she covers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen... Conrad has propped himself against the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad!  What have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won, Helen.  I did it.  I won.  I'm the better man. He crawls toward her, slipping on the wet carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been through a bad patch, Helen.  But now, he's gone... There's nothing to come between us... He reaches for her foot, his hand gloved with wet red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me!  You stupid piece of shit!  You've ruined it!  I had it all planned perfectly and you've ruined it! She checks her watch; two hours to midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get out of here!  I have to get away! Conrad seizes hold of her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Let go!  Now! The look in his eyes frightens her.  She tries to kick fr of him but he won't let go.  Twisting, she reaches for th door but slips on the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad, damn you!  Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Helen, you're not leaving me... not this time... not ever. He crawls up her body still clutching the bloody knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please!  Oh god, no!  Oh god, please help me! Conrad raises the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can help us, Helen.  God is dead. The knife falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey hears V on the spiral staircase.

dialogues.speaker: V
dialogues.text: Scarlet footprints trail behind V as he struggles down th stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back. He nods and then collapses, rolling down the rest of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: V
dialogues.text: Running to him, she falls to his side.  His clothes are s with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late for that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't say that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey, listen to me.  I've not long and there are things that must be said. His voice strains beneath the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have done that which I came to do.  Now, it is time for me to rest and with me the past will, at last, find peace. Trembling, Evey holds him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the world, the world is not saved... Do not think that, when the fires die and the smoke clears, there is no miracle... there is only a path... upon which they must learn to rule themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they need you, V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me, Evey, not me.  I told you I am the villain.  The destroyer... But yes, they will need help... He reaches up and wipes a tear from her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kept my promise to you, Evey... Now you must promise me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me... you will discover the face under this mask... but you will never look beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me.  Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Eve.  Wherever I shall go, I shall always love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V, you are not going anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnight... Midnight.  Eve... Make them remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to die, V!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me be there, Evey, when it begins... Please, let me hear the music, one last time... my music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you won't... I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My love... Ave Atque vale... Holding him as tight as she can, she feels his life drain away, slipping through her arms in the way the last grain sand pour through the neck of the hourglass. She buries her face beside his and weeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous crowd has begun to gather in the streets surrounding the New Government Building.  With the crowd, restlessness swells against each barricade erected by the military. A sergeant stands on an armored car, speaking through a megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return to your homes!  There is nothing to see!  The terrorist is dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be here, just like he said!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey huddles against the stair railing, her face tear stained, staring at the lifeless body of V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember... I remember staring at the mask, at that smile. She touches the mask, her fingers finding its edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of me couldn't believe he was dead and maybe that was why.  The smile was still the same.  It made me want to tear it off so I could see the face, so I could see that he was dead. Her fingers stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I had promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will discover the face under this mask but you will never look beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I began to try to imagine his face.  Of course, I had long pictured my father behind that smile but I knew in my heart that V was not my father. Evey stares into the eyes, the dark, empty eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet every time I pictured another face, any face, something was lost, something important was somehow diminished.  V was more than a face.  V was V. Her expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, quite suddenly, quite naturally, I realized whose face must be beneath that mask.  It was the only face that mattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you won't... I know. A small smile creeps across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnight approaches and the crowd feels it.  Spilling everywhere, they fill the streets like a flood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey sets a final violet carson on the chest of V.  He is lying on a bed made of gelignite, covered in roses. Touching his mask, she bends over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, my love. Tenderly, she presses her lips to the smile, her eyes closing, her final tears blinking free. She backs away and V smiles, his lips wet with her kiss, cheek wet with her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ave Atque vale." On the train platform, Evey reaches through the window an starts the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked it up the next morning. The wheels churn as the train lurches forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hail and farewell."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Make them remember..." She watches the train disappear into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will, my love.  They will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd surges against a barricade when a voice cries o across the city echoing through the megaphone on every corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Remember, remember, the fifth of November!" High above the gathered mass, a masked figure steps out o a roof parapet. The crowd explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train barrels along, screaming against its rusted rai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed as V, Evey stands on the roof's edge, speaking in microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have come here tonight to keep a promise.  A promise that is over four hundred years old.  Tonight I am here to give you your freedom! Again, the crowd bursts into a frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since mankind's dawn a handful of oppressors have accepted the responsibility over our lives, responsibility that we should have accepted ourselves.  By doing so, they took our power.  By doing nothing, we gave it away. The voice booms over the mesmerized crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, our world will change.  Our leaders will be gone and we must choose what comes next.  A return to the chains of others or lives of our own.  A world of the past or one of the future. She feels the sea of humanity beneath her, almost channel their energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us choose carefully, London, and when we do, let us mark well and remember, remember this fifth of November! The crowd screams as one and their scream becomes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train hurling like a bullet through a gun barrel.  Ah the tracks end, buried beneath the rubble of the collapse tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the rattling train, V lays in perfect repose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me be there, Evey, when it begins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden and alone, Evey pulls the mask from her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let me hear the music... one last time... my music. Almost unconsciously, Evey raises her hand and coaxes the first soft notes as he had once done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, you have to listen carefully. The violins of the 1812 overture steadily rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes.  There it is.  Beautiful, is it not? Evey smiles, her hand still gently conducting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my love.  Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the clash of cymbals, the train crashes into the wal rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire building opens like a time-lapsed rose bloomin with brilliant orange petals of flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is awash in the baptismal glow of erupting flam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evey watches the explosion, a star-burst of flaming debri searing against the night sky like fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The masses burst through the barricades with a euphoric frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explosion begins to slowly die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that there is only one way to repay him for what he did. She looks down at the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know that that way is going to take a lot of hard work. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this like I know the sun will rise tomorrow and beneath that new sun, our work will begin. The fire fades and Evey turns, cradling the mask, and wal away.
